description: CAMP DANGWA, Benguet- The Police Regional Office-Cordillera has arrested four individuals for illegal possession of firearms and illegal drugs in the province of Abra. Carol Lacuata, regional information officer, said personnel of San Juan Municipal Police Station led by Lt. Reynaldo Bonuan were patrolling the area at around 11:20 p.m on June 2 in Barangay...
text:
By Zaldy Comanda

CAMP DANGWA, Benguet \- The Police Regional Office-Cordillera has arrested
four individuals for illegal possession of firearms and illegal drugs in the
province of Abra.

Maj. Carol Lacuata, regional information officer, said personnel of San Juan
Municipal Police Station led by Lt. Reynaldo Bonuan were patrolling the area
at around 11:20 p.m on June 2 in Barangay Badas, San Juan, Abra when they
intercepted the suspects riding in tandem: Nonoy Edaw Bag-ayan, 36, of Sitio
Palpalitpit, Barangay Cayapa, Lagangilang, Abra who was driving the motorcycle
without a plate number, and Lando Jaquias Batallia, 49, of Sitio Barbarsic,
San Juan, Abra.

Upon inspection, police found a caliber 9mm Beretta bearing serial number
N020220Z, chamber loaded, with magazine loaded with 12 live ammunition,
protruding from the driver's waist.

Another caliber 45 bearing serial number M07134518, chamber loaded, inserted
with magazine loaded with 4 live ammunition was also seized from the back
rider.

When Bonuan asked for pertinent documents for the firearms, the suspects
failed to present any.

In another development, live-in partners Carlen Marie Acena, 27, and Danilo
Bergonia,35, both residents of Barangay Lingtan, Bangued, Abra were arrested
for illegal drugs. Recovered from them were three transparent plastic sachets
of suspected shabu, eight assorted drug paraphernalia, and assorted live
ammunition.

Brig. Gen. R'win Pagkalinawan, regional director, lauded the operatives and
enjoined all the police force to exert more effort in the implementation of
laws. "We should not let the COVID- 19 pandemic allow these criminals to go
scot-free. Let's intensify our campaign against illegal drugs, illegal
firearms, and other forms of criminality, and let the criminals answer for
their offenses."

CAPTION(S):

title: 4 arrested for illegal firearms, drugs.(Luzon)
html:
By Zaldy Comanda

CAMP DANGWA, Benguet - The Police Regional Office-Cordillera has arrested four individuals for illegal possession of firearms and illegal drugs in the province of Abra.

Maj. Carol Lacuata, regional information officer, said personnel of San Juan Municipal Police Station led by Lt. Reynaldo Bonuan were patrolling the area at around 11:20 p.m on June 2 in Barangay Badas, San Juan, Abra when they intercepted the suspects riding in tandem: Nonoy Edaw Bag-ayan, 36, of Sitio Palpalitpit, Barangay Cayapa, Lagangilang, Abra who was driving the motorcycle without a plate number, and Lando Jaquias Batallia, 49, of Sitio Barbarsic, San Juan, Abra.

Upon inspection, police found a caliber 9mm Beretta bearing serial number N020220Z, chamber loaded, with magazine loaded with 12 live ammunition, protruding from the driver's waist.

Another caliber 45 bearing serial number M07134518, chamber loaded, inserted with magazine loaded with 4 live ammunition was also seized from the back rider.

When Bonuan asked for pertinent documents for the firearms, the suspects failed to present any.

In another development, live-in partners Carlen Marie Acena, 27, and Danilo Bergonia,35, both residents of Barangay Lingtan, Bangued, Abra were arrested for illegal drugs. Recovered from them were three transparent plastic sachets of suspected shabu, eight assorted drug paraphernalia, and assorted live ammunition.

Brig. Gen. R'win Pagkalinawan, regional director, lauded the operatives and enjoined all the police force to exert more effort in the implementation of laws. "We should not let the COVID- 19 pandemic allow these criminals to go scot-free. Let's intensify our campaign against illegal drugs, illegal firearms, and other forms of criminality, and let the criminals answer for their offenses."
